vclaim: It says a picture shows that Donald Trump holds a sign that says, "It doesn't matter who the President is, Jesus is still king."
date: stated on August 28, 2019 in a post on Facebook:
title: This picture of Donald Trump with a sign that Jesus is still a king isn't real.
text: President Donald Trump recently criticized his re-transmission to radio as "the King of Israel," but it appears that an article from 28 August Facebook shows a picture of Trump with a sign: "It doesn't matter who the President is, Jesus is still king." Many people have commented on the president. Others were unreasonable. Do you really think he's holding that sign? He wrote one of the novels. "Why do you care what I think?" He responded to another account. "It's clear that many others thought so too" Facebook was published on February 7, 2021 in an article on Facebook, "The Devil was diagnosed in the Super Bowl of Satan." • On February 8, 2012, this article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misinformation in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) That's because the picture was rounded up. Trump actually carries an announcement he signed on May 7, 2018, during an event at the Rose Garden of the Melania Trump Initiative "Be the Best." You can see many pictures of Associated Press from that day here and here. In April, Snoops checked a similar article on Facebook that looked like Trump was carrying a shirt that said, "It doesn't matter who the President of Christ is still king." Those were also manipulated. The original photo shows the president holding a shirt with his name and 45 on his back, according to Snoops. We're assessing this wrong Facebook post.
